member.name: T:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Enumerator.CardNetworkEnumerator
member.summary: A list of known network payment card types.

member.name: T:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Extension.CardNetworkExtension
member.summary: An extension class for converting card networks to enumerators and to human readable text.

member.name: M:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Extension.CardNetworkExtension.ToCardNetworkEnumerator(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the network name in a string to an enumerator. For example: Amex would be converted to CardNetworkEnumerator.AmericanExpress.

member.name: M:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Extension.CardNetworkExtension.ToHuman(OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Enumerator.CardNetworkEnumerator)
member.summary: Converts a card network enumerator to a human readable title cased string.

member.name: T:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card
member.summary: A generic data object containing the standard data associated to the different types of payment cards.

member.name: P:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card.Bin
member.summary: A bank identification number (BIN) is the initial four to six numbers that appear on a card. The bank identification number uniquely identifies the institution issuing the card. The BIN is key in the process of matching transactions to the issuer of the card. This numbering system applies to charge cards, gift cards, debit cards, prepaid cards, and electronic benefit cards.

member.name: P:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card.Number
member.summary: A card number is usually 15-16 digits long, but it could be as many as 19 digits or as few as 13 in some cases. Each of these individual credit card numbers has meaning.

member.name: P:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card.ExpirationMonth
member.summary: A card expiration month tells you when the card is no longer valid along with the expiration year. After a card expires, it shouldn't be usable, because the issuers should deactivate the card when it reaches the expiration date.

member.name: P:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card.ExpirationYear4Digit
member.summary: A card expiration year tells you when the card is no longer valid along with the month year. After a card expires, it shouldn't be usable, because the issuers should deactivate the card when it reaches the expiration date.

member.name: P:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card.NameOnCard
member.summary: This is the person authorized to use the card. That person didnâ€™t necessarily open the account, they might simply have permission to spend from the account as an "authorized user."

member.name: P:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card.MagneticTrack1
member.summary: The first of three megnetic tracks on a card that typically contains encoded information about the cardholder's account, such as their card number, full name, the card's expiration date and the country code.

member.name: P:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card.MagneticTrack2
member.summary: The second of three megnetic tracks on a card that typically contains encoded information about the cardholder's account, such as their card number, full name, the card's expiration date and the country code.

member.name: P:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card.MagneticTrack3
member.summary: The third of three megnetic tracks on a card that typically contains any additional encoded information from the issuer.

member.name: P:OpenPath.Dto.Generic.Payment.Card.Network
member.summary: A card network are networks of issuing and acquiring banks through which payment cards of some certain brand are processed.
